Introduction to CSS.question: CSS stands for __________
Introduction to CSS.explanation: CSS is a style sheet language which stands for Cascading Style Sheet.

Introduction to CSS.question: In CSS, h1 can be called as _______
Introduction to CSS.explanation: HTML element h1 is used in CSS for styling then it is also called a selector. Attributes are the special words which control the element‚Äôs behaviour. To show the start and end of HTML element, tag is used.

Introduction to CSS.question: In css, ‚Äúcolor:red‚Äù can be called as _____________
Introduction to CSS.explanation: In CSS, color:red is the declaration for an element saying that the given element has to apply a red color. Color is one of CSS property.

Introduction to CSS.question: Which of the following attributes is used to specify elements to bind style rules to?
Introduction to CSS.explanation: In CSS, styling elements can be done by id, class and tag attribute.

Introduction to CSS.question: Which selector is used to specify a rule to bind a particular unique element?
Introduction to CSS.explanation: For binding a particular unique element, id selectors are used. While for group of elements, class selector can be used.

Introduction to CSS.question: In CSS, ‚Äúfont-size‚Äù can be called as ________
Introduction to CSS.explanation: In CSS, font-size is a property-name which increases/decreases the font of text.

Introduction to CSS.question: _________ selectors are used to specify a group of elements.
Introduction to CSS.explanation: Class selectors are used to specify a group of elements. Id selector specifies a particular unique element.

Introduction to CSS.question: Which of the following tag is used to embed css in html page?
Introduction to CSS.explanation: <style> </style> tag is used to embed CSS in HTML page, while <script> </script> is used to embed JS in HTML. <!DOCTYPE html> is HTML5 declaration.

Introduction to CSS.question: __________ has introduced text, list, box, margin, border, color, and background properties.
Introduction to CSS.explanation: CSS is a style sheet language which stands for Cascading Style Sheet. CSS has introduced text, list, box, margin, border, color, and background properties.

CSS Functions.question: Which of the following element is used by the filter property to blur the images?
CSS Functions.explanation: Blurs an element, for use by the filter property. Accepts a distance measurement within which pixels are randomly scattered. A value of 0 leaves the image as is.

CSS Functions.question: Which of the following function adjust the brightness of an element‚Äôs color, for use by the filter property?
CSS Functions.explanation: A value of 100% or decimal value of 1 leaves the image as is, while 0 produces black. Increasing the value from 1 or 100% brightens pixels from their original values.

CSS Functions.question: Which of the following function adjusts the difference between light and dark values, for use by the filter property?
CSS Functions.explanation: A value of 100% or a decimal value of 1 leaves the image as is, while 0 results in black. Increasing the value past 1 or 100% produces more dramatically stratified areas of light and dark.

CSS Functions.question: Which of the following function with filter property to create your own sophisticated effects on DOM elements?
Which of the following function converts an element‚Äôs color to a shade of gray, for use by the filter property?
CSS Functions.explanation: A decimal value between 0 and 1 or percentage up to 100% controls the extent of the gray effect.

CSS Functions.question: Which of the following function flips an element‚Äôs colors, for use by the filter property?
CSS Functions.explanation: A decimal value between 0 and 1 or percentage up to 100% controls the extent of the color-negative effect, with 0.5 or 50% producing gray.

CSS Functions.question: Which of the following function applies a saturation effect to an element‚Äôs color, making it appear more or less vivid, for use by the filter property?
CSS Functions.explanation: A decimal value of 1 or percentage of 100% keeps the image as is, while increasing the amount produces more dramatically stratified hues.

CSS Versions.question: Which of the following is the CSS Extension Prefixes for Webkit?
CSS Versions.explanation: Browser sometimes adds prefixes to non-standard CSS properties. CSS Extension prefix for Webkit is -webkit which is supported by almost all ios browsers. -o is used by opera where as -moz is used by firefox browser.

CSS Versions.question: Which CSS property is equivalent for the attribute <center>?
CSS Versions.explanation: The attribute <center> in html aligns the text in center. In CSS, this is equivalent to align property which can align text to right, left or center as per the value. Margin property sets the margin for an element. Color property is used to set/assign colour to element. Font property is for increasing/decreasing the font of text.

CSS Versions.question: Which CSS property is Equivalent for the align attribute?
CSS Versions.explanation: In the case of some elements such as , the CSS float property is more appropriate than text-align. text-align. Center attribute can only align text to center. Now-a-days it is not supported.

CSS Versions.question: Which is the latest version of CSS available?
CSS Versions.explanation: There are three different kinds of versions of CSS i.e CSS1, CSS2 and CSS3. Out of them CSS3 is the latest version to be used.

CSS Versions.question: Which CSS property is equivalent for the attribute <font>?
CSS Versions.explanation: Both font-style and font-family are for styling the text. They show text in different kinds of styles. Color is for setting/assigning colour to text or element. The font-size property in CSS is equivalent to attribute <font>. Both of them either increase/decrease the font of text.

CSS Versions.question: Which of the following CSS property is used to give a line over the text?
CSS Versions.explanation: Text-decoration is a CSS property used to decorate the text. The text-decoration property takes many values such as overline, underline, line-through, none, inherit, etc. Overline gives a line over the text. Underline value is used to add line under the text. None value defines a normal text. When one wants to give a line through the text, line-through value for text-property can be used.

CSS Versions.question: The first CSS specification to become an official W3C Recommendation is ___________
CSS Versions.explanation: The first CSS specification to become an official W3C Recommendation is CSS level 1, published on December 17, 1996. H√•kon Wium Lie and Bert Bos are credited as the original developers.

CSS Versions.question: _________ first became a Candidate Recommendation on February 25, 2004, but it was reverted to a Working Draft on June 13, 2005 for further review.
CSS Versions.explanation: CSS level 2 revision 1, often referred to as ‚ÄúCSS 2.1‚Äù, fixes errors in CSS 2, removes poorly supported or not fully interoperable features and adds already implemented browser extensions to the specification. To comply with the W3C Process for standardizing technical specifications, CSS 2.1 went back and forth between Working Draft status and Candidate Recommendation status for many years. CSS 2.1 first became a Candidate Recommendation on February 25, 2004, but it was reverted to a Working Draft on June 13, 2005 for further review.

CSS Versions.question: There is no single, integrated ____________________ because it is split into separate modules.
CSS Versions.explanation: Here is no single, integrated CSS4 specification,[42] because it is split into separate modules. However, there are ‚Äúlevel 4‚Äù modules.

CSS Versions.question: Unlike CSS 2, which is a large single specification defining various features?
CSS Versions.explanation: Unlike CSS 2, which is a large single specification defining various features, CSS 3 is divided into several separate documents called ‚Äúmodules‚Äù. Each module adds new capabilities or extends features defined in CSS 2, preserving backward compatibility.

Specification of CSS.question: ___________ describes CSS properties to manipulate the position of ‚Äúruby‚Äù, which are small annotations on top of or next to words, especially common in Chinese and Japanese.
Specification of CSS.explanation: Align is used to align the content either left, right or center. Ruby describes CSS properties to manipulate the position of ‚Äúruby‚Äù, which are small annotations on top of or next to words, especially common in Chinese and Japanese. They are often used to give the pronunciation or meaning of difficult ideograms. Text-align is for aligning the text either left, right or in center.

Specification of CSS.question: ___________ has a grammar but unlike traditional (X)HTML it is not defined with a document type definition.
Specification of CSS.explanation: CSS 2.1 has a grammar (www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/grammar.html) but unlike traditional (X)HTML it is not defined with a document type definition. Instead the CSS specification is a combination of prose and a grammar that could be used to build a simple parser.

Specification of CSS.question: Which of the following is the correct way to applying style to a document?
options: Use an external style sheet, either by importing it or by linking to it
Directly embed a document-wide style in the head element of the document
Set an inline style rule using the style attribute directly on an element
Specification of CSS.explanation: We can style the document using CSS in three different ways i.e embed, inline and external. In any way as mentioned, we can apply CSS. An inline CSS means applying styles rules directly to the element. In embed, we declare or write all the needed style in <style></style> tag in the head element of the document. Expect these two ways we can also use another way in which we can create an external style sheet and provide its link to the document.

Specification of CSS.question: What does screen media type is used for?
Specification of CSS.explanation: In CSS, media types are used for the compatibility of devices. There are four types of nedia types i.e all, print, screen and speech. Out of which screen media type is used for computer screens, tablets, smart-phones, etc.

Style Inclusion Methods.question: Which of the following tag is used to linked information should be placed inside?
Style Inclusion Methods.explanation: Linked information regarding CSS like external CSS document information is always placed in <head> tag. <body> tag contains the body of the document.

Style Inclusion Methods.question: Which of the following tag can be used to embed a Document-wide styles in a document‚Äôs head element?
Style Inclusion Methods.explanation: Document-wide styles can be embedded in a document‚Äôs head element using the <style> tag. <script> </script> tag is used for Javascript.

Style Inclusion Methods.question: The ________________ directive allows style sheets to be grouped and joined together, though some might wonder what the value of this function is given what linked styles provide.
Style Inclusion Methods.explanation: Within embedded <style> blocks, properties can be imported from an external file and expanded in place, similar to a macro. Importing can be used to include multiple style sheets. An imported style is defined within a <style> tag using @import followed optionally by a type value and a URL for the style sheet. <style> & <script> tag conatins CSS and Javascript content respectively. The metadata content is present in <head> tag.

Style Inclusion Methods.question: Which of the following measurement defines a measurement relative to a font‚Äôs x-height?
Style Inclusion Methods.explanation: Defines a measurement relative to the height of a font in em spaces. Because an em unit is equivalent to the size of a given font, if you assign a font to 12pt, each em unit would be 12pt, thus 2em would be 24pt.

Style Inclusion Methods.question: Which of the following measurement defines measurement as a percentage?
Style Inclusion Methods.explanation: Defines a measurement as a percentage. Percentages are denoted by a number followed by the % symbol and are always relative to another value such as length. Quite often they are used to specify some value relative to an inherited value from a parent element.

Style Inclusion Methods.question: Which of the following property sets the font size of text?

Syntax:

font-size: length | percentage | larger | smaller | xx-small | x-small | 
small | medium | large | x-large | xx-larger | inherit

Style Inclusion Methods.question: Which of the following property sets a variation of the specified or default font family?
Style Inclusion Methods.explanation:
Syntax:

advertisement

The small-caps value sets text in smaller-size all capitals. The normal value would be used to override any inherited font-variant value. Font-weight is for increasing/decreasing weight of font. It takes values like normal, bold, lighter, and bolder.

Style Inclusion Methods.question: Which of the following property defines labels for a list of items?

Syntax:

list-style-type defines labels for a list of item. List-style property set all the properties for a list. List-style-image assign image to a list item.
Syntax:

Style Inclusion Methods.question: Which of the following property sets the amount of spacing between letters?
Style Inclusion Methods.explanation:
letter-spacing property sets the amount of spacing between letters.
Syntax:

letter-spacing: length | normal | inherit

Length values can be set in various units (negative values are permitted) or to the default value normal.

CSS Color Values.question: Which of the following CSS3 Color Feature can be used as a macro for whatever the current color is?
CSS Color Values.explanation: This is useful if you want to dynamically change one color and have other related colors change.

CSS Color Values.question: Which of the following CSS3 Color Feature like RGB color but adds an alpha channel value to specify the opacity of the color?
CSS Color Values.explanation: An RGBa is specified via a function style rgba(r,g,b,a) value, where colors r, g, and b are specified as a decimal value from 0 to 255 or a percentage from 0 to 100%, and the alpha channel value for defining opacity is a number between 0 (fully transparent) and 1 (fully opaque). Values outside this range will be rounded up or down to fit the closest value.

CSS Color Values.question: Which of the following Color Format is a CSS‚Äôs six-digit hexadecimal format is the same as color defined in (X)HTML?
CSS Color Values.explanation: The format specifies color as #rrggbb, where rr is the amount of red, gg the amount of green, and bb the amount of blue, all specified in a hexadecimal value ranging from 00 to FF.

CSS Media Types.question: ____________ types are mutually exclusive in the sense that a user agent can only support one media type when rendering a document.

CSS Inheritance and Cascade.question: Which of the following are different origins of style sheets?
CSS Inheritance and Cascade.explanation:
Author: The author specifies style sheets for a source document according to the conventions of the document language. For instance, in HTML, style sheets may be included in the document or linked externally.
User: The user may be able to specify style information for a particular document. For example, the user may specify a file that contains a style sheet or the user agent may provide an interface that generates a user style sheet (or behaves as if it did).
User agent: Conforming user agents must apply a default style sheet. A user agent‚Äôs default style sheet should present the elements of the document language in ways that satisfy general presentation expectations for the document language

CSS Inheritance and Cascade.question: Which of the following rule allows users to import style rules from other style sheets?
CSS Inheritance and Cascade.explanation: The @import rule allows users to import style rules from other style sheets. If an @import rule refers to a valid stylesheet, user agents must treat the contents of the stylesheet as if they were written in place of the @import rule.

Appearance of Form Elements.question: Which property is used to add space inside the text field?
Appearance of Form Elements.explanation:
Padding property is used to add space inside the text field, when we have many inputs after each other we can also add some margin to add more space outside,

 input[type=text] {padding:13px 30px; margin: 8px 0;}

Appearance of Form Elements.question: Which one can animate the width of search input when get focus?
Appearance of Form Elements.explanation:
For animating the width of search input when it gets focus we used CSS transition property,

 input[type=text] {-webkit-transition: width 09s ease-in-out; transition: width 0.9s ease-in-out; } input[type=text]:focus {width:100%;}

Appearance of Form Elements.question: Which of the following will insert generated content in the counter?
Appearance of Form Elements.explanation: content inserts generated content, counter-reset creates or resets a counter, counter-increment increments the value of the counter, counter() function adds the value of a counter to an element.

Appearance of Form Elements.question: Which of the following is not the pseudo class for CSS Basic UI Level3?
Appearance of Form Elements.explanation: CSS Basic UI Level 3 has many pseudo-classes like :widget, :invalid, :valid, :in-range, :required, :read-write, :read-only, :optional, :out-of-range. CSS Selector Level 3 has the classes :disabled, :enabled, :indeterminate, :checked.

Appearance of Form Elements.question: Which is not a Mozilla CSS Extension?
Appearance of Form Elements.explanation: Mozilla CSS Extensions include :-moz-placeholder, :-moz-ui-invalid, :moz-ui-valid, :moz-submit-invalid. ::-webkit-input-placeholder is Webkit CSS Extension, :-ms-input-placeholder is Microsoft CSS Extension.

Appearance of Form Elements.question: Which of the following is an extension to the common JavaScript framework?
Appearance of Form Elements.explanation: Formalize is an extension to common JavaScript frameworks like JQuery, Dojo, YUI etc., it helps to normalize and customize the forms. Uni-form standardizes form markup, styling it with CSS, it also offers a few additional features when used with jQuery.

Appearance of Form Elements.question: Which of the following will provide date pickers?
Appearance of Form Elements.explanation: jQuery UI offers some very interesting and advanced as well as customizable widgets like date pickers with special attention given to accessibility. Niceforms is a standalone JavaScript method that provides complete customization of web forms.

Appearance of Form Elements.question: Which of the following helps to deal with HTML5 support?
Appearance of Form Elements.explanation: WebShim is a big tool that can help with browser HTML5 support, web form part can be very helpful. If you want to normalize forms Twitter Bootstrap can greatly help.

Appearance of Form Elements.question: Which is not a WebKit value?
Appearance of Form Elements.explanation: WebKit includes various values like checkbox, button, button-level, menulist, scrollbarbutton-up, listitem, scrollbarbutton-left, caret, textfield, textarea, searchfield, searchfield-decoration, slider-vertical, slider-horizontal, scrollbargripper-horizontal etc.

Appearance of Form Elements.question: Which is not a Mozilla value?
Appearance of Form Elements.explanation: Mozilla includes many values like menulist, radio, scrollbar, dialog, listbox, scrollbarbutton-down, scrollbar, resizer, checkbox, scrollbarbutton-up, separator, toolbar, toolbox, statusbar, separator, toolbarbutton, window, treetwisty, treeview etc.

Appearance of Form Elements.question: Which is not the property of CSS box model?
Appearance of Form Elements.explanation: CSS box model include height, width, padding, margin and border. All text-fields have complete support for every property related to CSS box model. Browser relies on system default styles when displaying these widgets.

Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.topic: Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Image Alignment, ID and Class
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.question: Which of the following is not the value for an unordered list?
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.explanation:
For unordered list, we can use none, disc, square, circle. For ordered list, we can use decimals, decimal-leading-zero, lower-alpha, upper-roman, lower-roman.

 ol {list-style-type: lower roman;}

Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.topic: Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Image Alignment, ID and Class
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.question: Which of the following value sits to the left of the block of text?
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.explanation: List are indented into the page by default and list-style-position property indicates whether the marker should appear on inside or outside box containing main points. This property can take two values outside and inside. The marker sits to the left of the block of text, this is the default behavior if this property is not used.

Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.topic: Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Image Alignment, ID and Class
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.question: Which is not a box-level element?
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.explanation:
CSS treats each HTML element as if it is in its own box. This box will either be block-level Box or inline box. Block-level elements start on a new line e.g.

,

    ,
  • and

    . Inline elements follow in between surrounding text like , , .

Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.topic: Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Image Alignment, ID and Class
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.question: In which every block-level element appears on a new line?
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.explanation: Every block-level element appears on a new line, which causes each item to appear lower down the page than the previous one. Even if we specify the width of the boxes and there is space for two elements to sit side by side, they will not appear next to each other.

Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.topic: Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Image Alignment, ID and Class
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.question: Which of the following will take the element out of normal flow?
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.explanation: Floating an element allows us to take that element out of normal flow and position it too far left or right of a containing box. The floated element becomes block-level element around which other content can flow.

Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.topic: Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Image Alignment, ID and Class
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.question: Which value clear property can‚Äôt take?
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.explanation: The clear property allows us to say that no element within the same containing element should touch left or right hand sides of a box. It can take the values left, right, both or none. When set to none elements can touch either side.

Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.topic: Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Image Alignment, ID and Class
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.question: Which of the property is not used for positioning columns next to each other?
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.explanation: Many web pages used multiple columns in their design. The three CSS properties are used to position columns next to each other. Width, margin, and float. Width sets the width of the column, float positions columns next to each other, margin creates a gap between columns.

Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.topic: Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Image Alignment, ID and Class
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.question: Which of the following is not the value for background-repeat property?
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.explanation: Background-repeat property can have four values i.e. repeat, repeat-x, repeat-y and no -repeat. The background image is repeated both horizontally and vertically by setting the value repeat, repeat-x repeats the image horizontally only.

Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.topic: Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Image Alignment, ID and Class
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.question: Which of the following will move the image up and down?
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.explanation: The background image moves up and down as the user scrolls up and down the page. The fixed value helps background image stays in the same position on the page.

Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.topic: Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Image Alignment, ID and Class
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.question: Which should be used to overlay text on image with high contrast?
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.explanation: To overlay text on an image with high contrast, we can place a semi-transparent background color or ‚Äúscreen‚Äù behind the text to improve legibility. The majority of photographs have quite high contrast, that means they are not ideal for use as background image.

Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.topic: Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Image Alignment, ID and Class
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.question: ID selector name is preceded by __________
Specifying Bullet Point Styles, CSS Imag.explanation:
In CSS class selector name is preceded by a full stop (‚Äò.‚Äô) and ID selector name is preceded by hash character (‚Äò#‚Äô).

#intro {background-color: red; padding: 30px; }, .top {color: white; font-weight: bold; }

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: Which of the following will represent browsers in their normal states?
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation: There are five major categories for image replacement i.e. CSS ON/Images ON, CSS ON/Images OFF, CSS OFF/Images ON, CSS OFF/Images ON, CSS OFF/Images OFF, Extra Unnecessary Markup. CSS ON/Images ON represents browsers in their normal states and all the techniques should pass their test.

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: Which of the following represents browsing with no stylesheets applied?
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation: CSS OFF/Images ON represents browsing with no stylesheets being applied. Most of the techniques default to regular web text here which is not exactly a fail, but since images may still be turned on.

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: Which of the following technique is also known as Fahrner Image Replacement?
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation: CSS ON/Images On technique is also known as FIR or ‚ÄúFahrner Image Replacement‚Äù. The premise here is to use a span to wrap the text inside the header and use that span to hide the text. It works but we have to use display:none.

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: Using negative text-indent is also known as __________
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation: Using negative text-indent is also known as the Phark method. This is the most common technique that most web developers have used. The main idea is to move the text far outside the browser window by setting a large negative text-indent.

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: Using margin is also known as________
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation: Using margin is also used as Radu Darvas technique. This technique also forces the text outside of the browser window but uses margins to do so. The main idea is to apply very large negative left margin and give our header a correspondingly large width.

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: Using padding is also known as ________
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation: Using padding is known as Langridge method. We push the text outside of our header using padding-top property. The property is to be set to a value that is equal to the height of the logo. But this alone is not sufficient, we have to use overflow: hidden to hide the text.

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: Using Small font-size is also known as ____________
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation: Using small font-size is known as Lindsay method. Another way to hide text is by making it very small and set its color to the background of the image. This works without affecting accessibility but we can also face SEO penalties because of tiny font size and camouflaged color.

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: Using Overflow is known as ______
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation: In this method, overflow property is used to hide the element completely. Using this technique requires to wrap the text in a <span> element just like the other methods. The text is hidden by overflow: hidden property.

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: Using Absolute Positioning is known as _________
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation: This method also requires an additional <span> element to work. But the <span> element is not wrapped around the text but used to position our image.

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: Using a bogus image is also called as _______
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation: This method also requires a bogus image in addition to a usual <span> element to work properly. The image is a 1√ó1 pixel transparent GIF. The main purpose is to show users the alt text if images are turned off.

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: Using actual image with inline image method is also known as __________
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation: In this method, we use the actual image for image replacement. The image has alt text that will be shown when images are turned off. This technique does not seem to be good for SEO. Images will still be visible with CSS turned off and images kept on.

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: Using Pseudo element is known as _____________
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation:
This technique used the pseudo element to push the text aside.

Site

. The pseudo element pushes text aside. The text then overflows and is hidden by using overflow: hidden property.

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: What is the default value of visibility?
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation: The default value of visibility is visible, the element is visible. When set to hidden, the element is invisible but it still takes up space, initial sets the property to its default value. Inherit inherits this property from its parent element.

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: Which of the following is only for table elements?
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation: Collapse is only for table elements. Collapse removes row or column. But it does not affect table layout. The space taken up by row or column will be available for other content. If the collapse is used with other elements, it renders as ‚Äúhidden‚Äù.

Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.topic: Suppressing Element Display & Visibility, Image Replacement
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.question: Clip property is not supported in ____________
Suppressing Element Display & Visibility.explanation:
There is one more way of hiding elements by clipping them. Clip-path property is not fully supported in IE or Edge yet. If using external SVG files for clip-path, support is even more limited.

 .hide {clip-path: polygon(0px 0px,0px 0px,0px 0px,0px 0px);}

Print Styles and their Development.question: @page is not supported in ________
Print Styles and their Development.explanation: @page is not supported in Firefox, but is supported in Chrome 2.0+, IE 8.0+, Opera 6.0+ and safari 5.0+. @page:first is supported only in IE8+ and Opera 9.2+.

Print Styles and their Development.question: Which of the following does not break long URLs into a shorter one?
Print Styles and their Development.explanation: word-wrap breaks long URLs when they reach a certain limit. This property is basically supported in a wide range of browsers even in IE 6, it works in chrome when printing. Firefox automatically breaks long URLs, Internet Explorer has no capability for breaking long URLs into the shorter one.

Print Styles and their Development.question: Orphans and widows properties are supported by _________
Print Styles and their Development.explanation: Orphan property sets the number of lines for the bottom of the page. The orphans and widows properties are supported in IE 8+ and Opera 9.2+, but not in Firefox, Chrome or Safari.

Print Styles and their Development.question: Which of the following will take care of breaks behind an element?
Print Styles and their Development.explanation: There are three CSS attributes page-break before, page-break-after and page-break-inside that allow us to decide exactly where a print page will be broken. Among other things, this will prevent images from being broken into two pieces.

Print Styles and their Development.question: What prohibits the break?
Print Styles and their Development.explanation: Auto is print element‚Äôs standard, always places a break every time, avoid prohibits the break, left and right are for continuation pages that are formatted left or right accordingly.

Print Styles and their Development.question: Which of the following media type is used for computer screens?
Print Styles and their Development.explanation: The screen media type is used for computer screens, smart-phones, tablets etc. The print media type is used for printers, speech is used for screenreaders that ‚Äúreads‚Äù the page loud, all is used for all media type devices.

Print Styles and their Development.question: Which value specifies the number of colors the device can display?
Print Styles and their Development.explanation: The number of colors the device can display is specified by color-index, color-gamut specifies the approximate range of colors that are supported by a user agent and output device. The number of bits per color component for the output device is specified by color value.

Print Styles and their Development.question: Which value will define the viewport width?
Print Styles and their Development.explanation: Width specifies the width of the viewport, update specify how quickly can output device modify the appearance of the content, the scan is set for scanning process of the output device, the resolution of output device using dpi or dpcm is by resolution.

Print Styles and their Development.question: Which of the following will specify minimum width of display area?
Print Styles and their Development.explanation: The minimum width of a display area such as browser window is specified by min-width, min-resolution specify the minimum resolution of the device, using dpi or dpcm, monochrome specify the number of bits per ‚Äúcolor‚Äù on a monochrome device.

Print Styles and their Development.question: Which of the following specify the approximate range of colors?
Print Styles and their Development.explanation: The approximate range of colors that are supported by user agent and output device is specified by color-gamut, the number of colors the device can display is specified by color-index, the maximum number of bits per color component for the output device is specified by max-color.

.class selects all elements within the given class, #id selects the element within the given id, element>element selects all

elements where parent is

element, element selects all

elements.

elements and all

elements?

elements and all

elements, element element selects all

Server Specific CSS.question: Which of the following selects all elements with a target attribute?
Server Specific CSS.explanation: attribute selects all elements with a target attribute, attribute=value selects all elements for the given target, attribute~=value selects all elements with a title attribute containing the given title, attribute=value selects all elements with a lang attribute value starting with the given lang.

Server Specific CSS.question: Which of the following selects every <a> element whose href attribute value contains the given substring?
Server Specific CSS.explanation: attribute*=value selects every <a> element whose href attribute value contains the given substring, attribute$=value selects every <a> element whose href attribute value ends with the given href, attribute^=value selects every <a> element element whose href attribute value begins with ‚Äúhttps‚Äù.

Server Specific CSS.question:
Which of the following selects every

element that has no children?
Server Specific CSS.explanation:
:empty selects every

element that has no children including text nodes, :checked selects every checked element, :disabled selects every disabled element, :enabled selects every enabled element.

Server Specific CSS.question: Which of the following selects input element which has focus?
Server Specific CSS.explanation: :focus selects input element which has focus, :hover selects links on mouse hover, :in-range selects input elements with a value within a specified range, :invalid selects all input elements with an invalid value.

Server Specific CSS.question: Which selects all unvisited links?
Server Specific CSS.explanation:
:link selects all unvisited links, :not(selector) selects every element that is the second child of its parent, :last-child selects every

element that is the last child of its parent.

Server Specific CSS.question:
Which of the following will select every

element that is the only child of its parent?
Server Specific CSS.explanation:
:only-child selects every

element that is the only child of its parent, :only-of-type selects every

element that is the only child of its parent, :optional selects input elements with no ‚Äúrequired‚Äù attribute.

Server Specific CSS.question: Which selects document‚Äôs root element?
Server Specific CSS.explanation: :root selects the document‚Äôs root element, ::selection selects the portion of an element that is selected by a user, :required selects input elements with ‚Äúrequired‚Äù attribute specified, :out-of-range selects input elements with a value outside a specified range.

Server Specific CSS.question: Which selects all visited links?
Server Specific CSS.explanation: :visited selects all visited links, :valid selects all input elements with a valid value, :target selects the current active # element, ::selection selects the portion of an element that is selected by a user.

Server Specific CSS.question: background-blend-mode is not supported by?
Server Specific CSS.explanation: background-blend-mode is not supported by Internet Explorer, background-clip, background-color, background-image, background-origin, background-position, background, background-repeat, background-size are supported by all the browsers.

Server Specific CSS.question: @font-feature-values are only supported in _______________
Server Specific CSS.explanation: @font-feature-values are supported by Firefox only, font-kerning is supported by all the browsers, font-language-override is supported by firefox only, font-varient is supported by all the browsers.

Server Specific CSS.question: A grid is not supported by _______________
Server Specific CSS.explanation: Grid is not supported by Internet Explorer, grid-area, grid-auto-column, grid-column, grid-column-start, grid-column-end, grid-auto-row, grid-row-gap, grid-row-start is supported by all the browsers.

Server Specific CSS.question: outline-offset is not supported by _______________
Server Specific CSS.explanation: outline-offset is not supported by Internet Explorer, outline, outline-color, outline-style, outline-width are supported by all the browsers.

Server Specific CSS.question: @page is not supported by _________________
Server Specific CSS.explanation: @page is not supported by chrome, page-break-after, page-break-before, page-break-inside, perspective, perspective-origin, pointer-events, position are all supported by all the browsers.

Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.topic: Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CSS Pop-Ups & Menus
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.question: Which of the following is set for horizontal offset of the shadow?
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.explanation: h-offset is the required value, it is for the horizontal offset of the shadow. A positive value puts the shadow on the right side of the box, a negative value puts the shadow on the left side of the box.

Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.topic: Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CSS Pop-Ups & Menus
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.question: Which of the following is used for spread radius?
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.explanation: blur is an optional value, it sets the spread radius. A positive value increases the size of the shadow, a negative value decreases the size of the shadow. For blur radius we set the value blur, the higher the number, the more blurred the shadow will be spread.

Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.topic: Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CSS Pop-Ups & Menus
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.question: What changes the shadow from an outer shadow?
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.explanation: inset is an optional value, it changes the shadow from an outer shadow (outset) to an inner shadow, initial sets this property to its default value, inherit inherits this property from its parent element.

Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.topic: Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CSS Pop-Ups & Menus
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.question: What scales the background image as large as possible?
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.explanation: The contain keyword scales the background image to be as large as possible but both its width and its height must fit inside the content area. As such depending on the proportions of the background image and background positioning area, there may be some areas of background which are not covered by the background image.

Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.topic: Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CSS Pop-Ups & Menus
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.question: Which property specifies where the background image is positioned?
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.explanation: The CSS background-origin property specifies where the background image is positioned. This property takes three different values namely border-box, padding-box, content-box. In content-box the background images start from the upper left corner of the content.

Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.topic: Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CSS Pop-Ups & Menus
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.question: Which property specifies the painting area of the background?
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.explanation: The CSS background-clip property specifies the painting area of the background, the property takes three different values, border-box-, padding-box, content-box. In content-box the background is painted within the content box.

Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.topic: Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CSS Pop-Ups & Menus
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.question: Which of the following will show a pop-up window that breaks into pieces once clicked?
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.explanation: A pop-up window that breaks into pieces once clicked is called click and break it, in 3D movement effect a 3D message made with CSS3 and jQuery that follows user‚Äôs mouse movements will be shown.

Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.topic: Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CSS Pop-Ups & Menus
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.question: Which of the following comes with a smooth full screen overlay effect?
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.explanation: Overlay pop-up comes with a smooth full screen overlay effect, conformation pop-up comes with a full screen overlay effect and nice transition animation, welcome pop-up is a pop-up with nice animation effect.

Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.topic: Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CSS Pop-Ups & Menus
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.question: Which of the following will display a speech bubble pop-up?
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.explanation: cartoon pop-up shows a speech bubble pop-up that fades in once hovered in the circle, a pop-up question form that smoothly appears once clicked a button, in modal animation physics a transition animation inspired by the menu pop-ups in Super Mario 3D.

Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.topic: Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CSS Pop-Ups & Menus
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.question: Which of the following will give a minimalist entrance effect on hover?
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.explanation: A minimalist yet charming entrance effect on hover is shown by linear pop-up, a distinguishable pop-up with beautiful entrance effect and ‚Äúflappy‚Äù buttons are shown by ‚Äúflappy‚Äù buttons, a material design comes with a fade-in animation in material design style.

Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.topic: Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CSS Pop-Ups & Menus
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.question: What should be added to create a horizontal menu?
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.explanation: For creating a horizontal menu, we add pure-menu-horizontal class name, we can mark a selected list element by adding pure-menu-selected class to the list element, to create a scrollable horizontal menu, we add pure-menu-scrollable class name.

Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.topic: Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CSS Pop-Ups & Menus
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.question: Which of the following name should be added to mark a link as disabled?
Shadowy Styles, Multiple Backgrounds, CS.explanation: To mark a link as disabled we add an <a> element with pure-menu-disabled class name, responsive vertical menu collapses behind a hamburger, responsive horizontal-to-vertical-menu, slides out of view.

Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.question: Which of the following does not support the ‚Äú:hover‚Äù pseudoclass?
Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.explanation: IE 6 does not support the ‚Äú:hover‚Äù pseudoclass on elements other than anchor tags. To get hover work in IE6, we create a class that duplicates the :hover styles, and then script a function to toggle that class on/off.

Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.question: Which class is used for setting perspective and scroll properties for the page?
Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.explanation: .wrapper sets the perspective and scroll properties for the whole page, .section is for size, display and text properties, mostly not relevant to parallax effect, .static add a background to a section, just for demonstration.

Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.question: Which of the following is used for adding perspective background images for each section?
Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.explanation: .bg1, .bg2 adds the respective background images for each section, we can use img tag also, .parallax adds an ::after pseudo-element with the background image and transforms needed for the parallax effect.

Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.question: Which of the following position is based on the user‚Äôs scroll position?
Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.explanation: An element with position: sticky, is positioned on the user‚Äôs scroll position. A sticky element toggles between relative and fixed, depending on scroll position, It is positioned relative until a given offset position is met in the viewport, then it ‚Äústicks‚Äù in place.

Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.question: Which of the following does not support sticky version?
Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.explanation: Internet explorer, Edge 15 and earlier versions do not support sticky positioning. Safari requires a ‚Äìwebkit-prefix. W should also specify at least one of the top, right, bottom or left for sticky positioning to work.

Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.question: What sets the stack order of an element?
Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.explanation:
The z-index property specifies the stack order of an element i.e. which element should be placed in front of, or behind, the others, an element can have positive or negative stack order,

 img {position: absolute; left: 10px; top: 10px; z-index: -1;}

Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.question: What clips an absolutely positioned elements?
Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.explanation: clip clips an absolutely positioned element, bottom sets the bottom margin edge for a positioned box, position specifies the type of positioning for an element, right sets the right margin edge for a positioned box.

Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.question: Which of the following is positioned relative to the nearest positioned ancestor?
Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.explanation: An element with position: absolute; is positioned relative to the nearest positioned ancestor, instead of position relative to the viewport like fixed. However, if an absolute positioned element has no positioned ancestors, it uses the document body and moves along with page scrolling.

Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.question: Which of the following position element is not affected by the top, bottom, left etc. property?
Sliding Doors & Clipped Sliding Doors.explanation: HTML elements are positioned static by default, static positioned elements are not affected by top, bottom, left and right properties. An element with position: static; is not positioned in any social way, it is always positioned according to the normal flow of the page.

Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.topic: Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of Images & Constrained Images
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.question: What is the default value of object-fit?
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.explanation: Object-fit has can be set with five values. When set to the value fill, it is the default value which stretches the image to fit the content box, regardless of its aspect-ratio, contain increases or decreases the size of the image to fill the box whilst preserving its aspect-ratio.

Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.topic: Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of Images & Constrained Images
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.question: Which value will compare the difference between none and contain?
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.explanation: When setting the value to scale-down the image will compare the difference between none and contain in order to find the smallest concrete object size when set to cover the image will fill the height and width of its box.

Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.topic: Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of Images & Constrained Images
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.question: object-fit is not supported by _______
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.explanation: In the desktop, object-fit is not supported by Internet Explorer but supported by chrome, opera, firefox, edge, safari. In mobiles or tablets iOS Safari, Opera Mobile, Opera Mini, Android, Android Chrome, Android Firefox support this.

Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.topic: Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of Images & Constrained Images
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.question: Which of the following is a library for JavaScript?
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.explanation: PlotKit is a library for JavaScript that is an improved version of CanvasGraph. It lets us build various sorts of charts and graphs without a hitch. In list bar chart we style definition list and convert it into a timeline chart.

Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.topic: Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of Images & Constrained Images
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.question: Which of the following will not use JavaScript?
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.explanation: Pure CSS3 experimental charts do not use any JavaScript & zero image, but can be viewed in Webkit browsers. Animated Stacked Bar Graph use D3 chart and JavaScript, it is developed to mimic live data feed, and give an illusion of how to handle data on the backend.

Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.topic: Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of Images & Constrained Images
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.question: Which of the following uses AngulaJS?
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.explanation: 3D prisma are created with HTML and CSS3(D) transforms, shaded with CSS gradients, animated with CSS transitions. AngularJS is used to write up an updating dataset. The size and thickness of the animated donut chart can be easily edited via CSS, JavaScript will do the rest.

Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.topic: Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of Images & Constrained Images
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.question: Which of the following moves an element from its current position?

Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.topic: Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of Images & Constrained Images
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.question: Which of the following will rotate an element clockwise or counter-clockwise?
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.explanation:
The rotate() method rotates an element clockwise or counter-clockwise according to the given degree,

 div {-ms-transform: rotate(12deg); /*IE*/ -webkit-transform: rotate(12deg); transform: rotate(12deg); }

Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.topic: Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of Images & Constrained Images
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.question: Which of the following increases or decreases the size of element?
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.explanation:
The scale() method increases or decreases the size of an element according to the parameters given for width and height,

 div {-ms-transform: scale(3,5); -webkit-transform: scale(3,5); transform: scale(3,5);}

Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.topic: Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of Images & Constrained Images
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.question: What skews an element along X and Y-axis?
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.explanation:
The skew() method skews an element along X and Y-axis by the given angles,

 div {-ms-transform: skew(10deg, 20deg); -webkit-transform: skew(10deg,20deg); transform: skew(10deg,20deg);}

Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.topic: Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of Images & Constrained Images
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.question: What combines all the 2D transform methods into one?
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.explanation: The matrix() method combines all 2D transform methods into one, the matrix() method takes six parameters, containing mathematic functions, that allows us to rotate, scale, move or skew the elements.

Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.topic: Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of Images & Constrained Images
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.question: What does not affect the element itself?
Table Graphs, 2D Transforms, Boxing of I.explanation: perspective() does not affect the element itself, but affects the transforms of descendant element‚Äôs 3D transform, allowing them all to have a consistent depth perspective.

CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.question: Which value specifies a transition effect with a slow start, then fast, then end slowly?
CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.explanation: The transition-timing-function property takes the value ease. It specifies a transition effect with a slow start, then fast, then end slowly and this is the default value, ease-in specifies a transition effect with a slow start.

CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.question: Which of the following specifies a transition effect with same speed from start to end?
CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.explanation: linear value specifies a transition effect with the same speed from start to end, ease-in-out specifies a transition effect with a slow start and end, ease-out specifies a transition with a slow end.

CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.question: Which of the following specifies how many seconds a transition effect takes to complete?
CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.explanation: transition-duration specifies how many seconds or milliseconds a transition effect takes to complete, a transition is a shorthand property for setting the four transition properties into a single property.

CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.question: What specifies the speed curve of transition effect?
CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.explanation: transition-timing-function specifies the speed curve of transition effect, transition-property specifies the name of the CSS property the transition effect is for, transition-delay specifies a delay in seconds for transition effect.

CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.question: Which of the following defines a MIME string format of the content being returned?
CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.explanation: Content-type:string is a MIME string defining the format of the content being returned, example is content-type:text/html, last-modified: string defines the date of last modification of the file.

CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.question: What defines the date when information becomes invalid?
CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.explanation: expires: sate string defines the date when information becomes invalid. This should be used by the browser to decide when a page needs to be refreshed. A valid date string should be in the format 01 Jan 1998 12:00:00 GMT.

CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.question: Which of the following specifies the length of the data being returned?
CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.explanation: content-length: string specifies the length in bytes of the data being returned. The browser uses this value to report the estimated download time for a file. Set-cookie: string set the cookie passed through the string.

CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.question: Which variable defines the data type of the content?
CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.explanation: The data type of the content is defined by content_type variable, used when the client is sending attached content to the server, like file upload etc, the length of the query information is defined by content_length, it‚Äôs available only for POST requests.

CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.question: What returns the set cookies in the form of a key?
CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.explanation: http_cookie returns the set cookies in the form of key and value pair, in http_user_agent user-agent request-header field contains information about user agent originating the request. It‚Äôs the name of the web browser.

CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.question: Which of the following gives the path for CGI script?
CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.explanation: path_info provides the path for the CGI script, query_string gives URL-encoded information that is sent with GET method request, remote_addr gives the IP address of the remote host making the request.

CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.question: What gives the full path to CGI script?
CSS Transition & Perl CGI Programming.explanation: script_filename gives the full path to the CGI script, script_name gives the name of the CGI script, server_name gives the server‚Äôs hostname or IP address, request_method is the method used to make the request, the most common methods are GET and POST.

Miscellaneous.question: Which of the following is not a combinatory?
Miscellaneous.explanation: Combinator explains the relationship between the selectors. There are four combinators in CSS, child selector (>), adjacent sibling selector(+), general sibling selector(~), descendent selector (space).

Miscellaneous.question: Which of the following selects all elements that are siblings of the specified element?
Miscellaneous.explanation: General sibling selector selects all elements that are siblings of a specified element, adjacent sibling selector selects all elements that are adjacent siblings of the specified element, child selector selects all elements that are immediate children of the specified element.

Miscellaneous.question: Which of the following adds the value of a counter to an element?
Miscellaneous.explanation: counter() or counters() function adds value of counter to an element, content inserts generated content, counter-increment increments a counter value, counter-reset creates or resets a counter.

Miscellaneous.question: Which of the following specifies how to slice border image?
Miscellaneous.explanation: border-image-slice specifies how to slice border image, border-image-outset specifies the amount by which border image area extends beyond the border box, border-image is a shorthand property for setting all the border-image properties.

Miscellaneous.question: Which web font was developed by Apple and Microsoft in the late 1980s?
Miscellaneous.explanation: TrueType (TTF) is a font standard developed in the late 1980s by Microsoft and Apple. It is the most common font format for both Microsoft Windows and Mac OS operating systems.

Miscellaneous.question: Which of the following is a format for scalable computer fonts?
Miscellaneous.explanation: OpenType (OTF) is a format scalable for computer fonts, it was built on TrueType, and is a registered trademark of Microsoft. These fonts are used commonly today on major computer platforms.

Miscellaneous.question: Which font format is used in web pages?
Miscellaneous.explanation: WOFF is font format used in web pages. It was developed in 2009. It is essentially OpenType or TrueType with compression and additional metadata. The goal is to support font distribution from the server to client over the network with bandwidth constraints.

Miscellaneous.question: What value lets animation to play forwards first then backward?
Miscellaneous.explanation: When the value is set to alternate the animation is played forwards first then backward. When a value is set to alternate-reverse, the animation is played backward first, then forwards. At normal value the animation is played as normal, this is the default value.

Miscellaneous.question: Which value specifies animation with slow start?
Miscellaneous.explanation: ease-in specifies an animation with a slow start, ease-out specifies an animation with a slow end, linear specifies animation with same speed from start to end, ease specifies an animation with a slow start, then fast, then end slowly.

Miscellaneous.question: How many values are there for animation-full-mode property?
Miscellaneous.explanation: animation-fill-mode property specifies the style for the target element when an animation is not playing. There are four values for this property namely none, forwards, backwards, and both. None is the default value.

Miscellaneous.question: Which of the following specifies animation code?
Miscellaneous.explanation: Akeyframes specifies animation code, animation is shorthand property which sets all the animation property, animation-delay specifies the delay for start of the animation, animation-delay specifies a delay for start of the animation.

Miscellaneous.question: Which specifies the speed curve of animation?
Miscellaneous.explanation: animation-timing-function specifies the speed curve of animation, animation-play-state specifies whether the animation is running or paused, animation-name specifies the name of @keyframes animation.

Miscellaneous.question: How many values are there for the object-fit property?
Miscellaneous.explanation: object-fit property can have 5 properties names fill, contain, cover, none, scale-down. The default value is fill, the replaced content is sized to fill element‚Äôs content box, with help of contain the replaced content is scaled to maintain its aspect ratio while fitting element‚Äôs content box.

Miscellaneous.question: Which property specifies the number of columns an element should be divided into?
Miscellaneous.explanation: column-count specifies the number of columns an element should be divided into, column-fill specifies how to fill the columns, column-gap specifies the gap between columns, column-rule is for setting all the column-rule properties.

Miscellaneous.question: Which property is used for setting column-width and column-count?
Miscellaneous.explanation: columns is a shorthand property for setting column-width and column-count, column-width specifies suggested, optimal width for columns, column-span specifies how many columns an element should span across.
